screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .toml file in Microsoft Visual Studio Code
screenshot.caption: TOML file open in Microsoft Visual Studio Code

description: Developer Tom Preston-Werner created the open-source TOML format in 2013. Each TOML file consists of plain text key-value pairs that define a program's settings. Typically, related settings are divided into sections denoted by bracketed text (e.g., [New Section] ).
Many programs use one or more TOML files to store and load their settings. Users can edit these files to adjust the associated program's settings to their liking.
NOTE: TOML files are formatted similarly to .JSON and .YAML files. However, TOML is designed to be easier to read and understand than JSON and YAML.
